SEARCH
Package appDomain

Class XMLValidator

java.lang.Object
appDomain.XMLValidator
public class XMLValidator extends Object
Utility class for parsing XML file-related command-line arguments and validating file existence across multiple fallback locations.

This class is designed for apps that are run either from IntelliJ, a terminal, or a packaged JAR, where the XML file may be located in different folders (working directory, /res folder, or JAR directory).

  • Method Details

    • parseArgs

      public static String parseArgs(String[] args)
      Parses the command-line arguments and attempts to extract the first valid XML filename.

      This method filters out irrelevant Java runtime arguments (such as "java", "-jar", "*.jar") and returns the first argument that ends with ".xml". It also normalizes characters that users sometimes enter incorrectly such as fancy quotes or long dashes.

      Parameters:
      args - Command-line arguments passed to the program
      Returns:
      The extracted XML filename, or null if none found

    • check

      public static File check(String fileName)
      Attempts to validate the supplied filename and resolve its physical location by checking several fallback paths:
      1. Current working directory
      2. Working directory + /res/ folder
      3. Directory where the running JAR is located
      Parameters:
      fileName - The XML file name provided by the user or CLI parser
      Returns:
      A File object pointing to the actual file, or null if not found
